Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a game board containing tiles.
    Version:
    0.1.24032013
    Author:
    Gareth Gill, John Meikle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(int width, int height)
      Construct a board of a particular size.

    • Method Detail

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(int column,
           int row)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Get the tile at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        column - The column coordinate of the tile.
        row - The row coordinate of the tile.
        Returns:
        The particular tile at the specified location.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either the row or column is not within range.

      • setTile

        public void setTile(int column,
           int row,
           Tile newTile)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the tile at the specified location to a new tile.
        Parameters:
        column - The column coordinate of the tile.
        row - The row coordinate of the tile.
        newTile - The new tile for replacing the existing tile with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either the row or column is not within range.

      • getTokenPos

        public int[] getTokenPos()
        Get the current token position as a board coordinate.
        Returns:
        The token position as an integer array. Index 0 is the column, index 1 is the row.

      • setTokenPos

        public void setTokenPos(int column,
               int row)
        Set the current token position as a board coordinate.
        Parameters:
        column - The column number of the token.
        row - The row number of the token.

      • getTreasurePos

        public int[] getTreasurePos()
        Get the current treasure position as a board coordinate.
        Returns:
        The treasure position as an integer array. Index 0 is the column, index 1 is the row.

        public void setTreasurePos(int column,
                  int row)
        Set the current treasure position as a board coordinate.
        Parameters:
        column - The column number of the treasure.
        row - The row number of the treasure.
